1. High V-D can strengthen the system against infection, people with low V-D are more vulnerable.


THis is your hypothesis one, not HIS. At least not derived from his words.

I am never saying that statistical test is not useful, or not trustworthy, I am saying your hypothesis of this statistical test in general is not statistically test-able.

Let's put it simply. The premise of statistical test is that you CAN control variables. This 'can-or-can-not' is never statistically test-able. You take a leap of faith, that's all. Without it, all the merit of statistical test does not exist.

I am saying it is NOT, at least not always that you CAN control variables, especially when concerning complicated systems like society of living organism.

Savvy?

And the normal paradigm of justifying that you CAN is by persuading, NOT through statistics, but whatever convenient.
